text.156_Daf, 12_Line: It is such that the lower fences are higher than the upper fences.
text.113_Daf, 29_Line: "I have placed her blood upon a smooth rock, that it should not be covered."
text.113_Daf, 15_Line: "Zecharia, Zecharia, I have gotten rid of the best of them. Is it pleasing to you that I should get rid of all of them?"
text.110_Daf, 46_Line: "With wood." And the Rabbis praised the one with the wood [the most].
text.112_Daf, 66_Line: "If there is someone who has heard something from Kefar Saknia in Egypt, let him say it."
text.119_Daf, 0_Line: Rabbi Yehudah bar Nachmani, the public orator of Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish, taught as follows: It is written, Write down these words for yourself—implying that the Torah is to be put into writing; and it is also written, since it is through these words (lit., by word of mouth)—implying that it is not to be written down. What are we to make of this? It means: Regarding the written words, you are not at liberty to say them by heart; and the words transmitted orally, you are not at liberty to recite from a written text.
text.111_Daf, 59_Line: "It is enough that you should see your enemy [like this]."
text.111_Daf, 27_Line: "I am leaving and I will send someone else, but ask something that I can give you."
text.113_Daf, 74_Line: They brought out the other one in front of Caesar. They said to him,
text.110_Daf, 56_Line: Marta bat Baitos was a wealthy woman of Jerusalem. She sent her messenger and said to him,
text.111_Daf, 64_Line: "Like a one year old chick weighing two litar.
text.113_Daf, 68_Line: He said to them, 'It is written in the Torah (Exodus 22:19),
text.110_Daf, 33_Line: He ran away and he went and converted, and out from him came Rabbi Meir.
text.109_Daf, 51_Line: "How is this? That man is an enemy of this man. What do you want here?
text.113_Daf, 77_Line: "Hear O Israel, the Lord is our God, the Lord is one."' They took him out and killed him.
text.113_Daf, 90_Line: 'Give him to me and I will kiss him a little.' She said to him,
text.92_Daf, 27_Line: "Even though there is no acquisition [of land] for an idolater in the Land of Israel to remove the obligation of tithing, as it says,
text.110_Daf, 45_Line: "With wine and salt and oil," and one said to them,
text.110_Daf, 59_Line: "There is no fine flour, [but] there is white flour." She said to him,
text.112_Daf, 29_Line: 'Come and see how great is the power of embarrassment; as behold, the Holy One, blessed be He, helped Bar Kamtsa and [as a result], he destroyed His House and burned His Sanctuary.'"
text.113_Daf, 31_Line: six hundred thousand upon six hundred thousand, twice the amount that came out from Egypt. "The voice of Yakov - this [refers to] Vespasian Caesar, who killed in the city of Beitar four million [people],
